result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Set at zero to Latoya G.; and $630.09 to Jill S.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.  Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any balances  remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving three (3) years.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain HSED or GED.
Screened for PTSC and mental health screen to verify current diagnosis and take all prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Not to possess weapons.
No contact with Jill S., Latoya G., Michele A. nor coactor Denzel Harris.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, with credit for 106 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years.
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Possess no weapons
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with Jill S, Latoya G, Michele A, nor co-actor Denzel Harris, 
-Screened for PTSC and mental health screen to verify current diagnosis and take all prescribed medications
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
Restitution to Latoya G set at zero.
Defendant to pay restitution of $630.09 to Jill S through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge on count 1 through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Surcharge on count 2 waived in the interest of paying court costs and restitution.
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 2:  dismissed and read in
Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders presentence investigation and defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  APRIL 8, 2014  received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Terese Dick - SPD  819 N 6th Street, 9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:32 am.

Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Caleb Porter-West Allis Police Department Detective.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF543 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 1951 S 71st Street; 1910 S 73rd Street and Co-Defendant Denzell Harris

Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
